original_definition: 'divisibility' means the possibility for a TSO to use only part of the balancing energy bids or balancing capacity bids offered by the balancing service provider, either in terms of power activation or time duration;
generated_definition: 'divisibility' means the ability of a measure to be divided into smaller parts without losing its essential characteristics or value.
